alert.note: Alert for Curry County; Quay County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 6:35PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL ROOSEVELT, SOUTHEASTERN QUAY AND CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM MDT... At 635 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of San Jon to 8 miles southwest of Texico. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clovis, Portales, Farwell, Texico, Logan, San Jon, Grady, Glenrio, Ranchvale and Arch. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 347 and 373. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 375 and 397. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for northeastern and east central New Mexico.
